page.title: 18Widley Walk
page.content: In 1944 tanks were hidden under trees in many places to protect them from bombing while they waited for the Normandy Invasion. In Widley Walk you can still see the barred iron grids which stopped the heavy tanks from sinking into the earth. The night before the embarkation allied officers held a Knights' Vigil in Christ Church on top of the hill. People who lived nearby remember coming out in the morning to wish the tank crews 'God Speed' as they rumbled down into Portsmouth. 1984 saw many commemorative celebrations including a memorial service in Christ Church, a bonfire and barbecue at Fort Widley and several street parties.
